2.00.text:
When you were going on a night out 
 with him, what were you getting

4.60.text:
up to? Were you talking to girls? 
 Was he talking to girls?

22.88.text:
We were together for about 
 two and a half years,

25.72.text:
and towards the end, 
 we were arguing all the time.

30.16.text:
She didn't like the fact that I was 
 hanging round with a certain lad.

34.20.text:
I found out that 
 Callum's best friend

41.44.text:
she looked at me in disgust 
 because I knew about it.

52.32.text:
I felt like he should've said 
 something, because it was wrong.

60.44.text:
So, you know, if we got 
 back together, would you

63.40.text: kind of ditch your friend for me?

67.76.text: You know, the not very nice one.

70.64.text:
I completely lost all 
 trust with Callum,

73.04.text: he didn't tell me what was going on,

75.00.text:
when I feel like, 
 I'm his girlfriend,

78.68.text:
and obviously this guy 
 isn't a nice guy

81.04.text:
and he shouldn't have loyalties 
 to someone like that.

84.00.text: Are you OK with what he did?

86.44.text: No, I'm not OK with what he did.

87.72.text:
I've never agreed with it, 
 really, have I?

89.52.text:
I just always, like, seem to have 
 been in the middle of it.

92.88.text:
But you still chose 
 to hang round with him.

94.68.text:
Yeah, because he was good company, 
 we had good nights out

97.92.text: and he was a good laugh.

99.04.text:
But he was cheating on 
 his girlfriend.

102.60.text: I'm not up to stuff like that just

104.48.text:
because I have a friend that 
 does stuff like that.

106.56.text:
He said, you know, 
 he'd never cheat on me,

108.68.text:
he shouldn't judge me 
 by other people's standards

111.88.text:
but, you know, I think you become 
 who you surround yourself with.

115.20.text:
It's their relationship, 
 shouldn't affect our relationship.

118.48.text:
When you were going on a 
 night out with him,

120.28.text: what were you getting up to?

123.04.text:
Were you talking to girls? 
 Was he talking to girls?

127.16.text:
Yeah, obviously we were talking 
 to people but only

129.24.text:
because of the personalities, 
 like, I have as myself,

132.24.text:
like, you know me, 
 I'm a chatty person.

133.84.text:
If you're chatting to 
 a group of girls,

135.52.text:
are you going to mention, 
 "Oh, yeah, I've got a girlfriend"?

140.96.text:
you can talk to girls, 
 like, I'm not a psycho.

143.60.text:
It made me think, 
 was he cheating on me?

146.16.text:
Cos he was going out with 
 him all the time.

148.20.text:
She had, like, trust issues 
 because of my mate

150.56.text:
but I didn't want to get 
 involved in that type of stuff.

153.76.text:
Question is, could you 
 trust me again?

160.92.text: I do think I could trust you again.

164.68.text:
It's just depends what 
 choices you made,

167.84.text: who you choose to hang around with.

170.76.text:
At the time, I really thought, 
 "Oh, my God, maybe he has cheated."

173.60.text:
But now I've sat and thought about 
 it, I know you wouldn't ever

176.20.text:
cheat on me. Why did you react, 
 like, the way you did?

180.16.text: Erm, just because I felt lied to.

183.64.text:
But there was no way of trying 
 to explain it to you.

186.88.text:
And obviously we had each other 
 blocked off everything

189.52.text:
so you wouldn't have realised that. 
 You wouldn't have...

195.60.text:
I blocked her because I just 
 felt like it was easier for me

198.88.text:
to move on with things, I didn't 
 want to see her enjoying herself.

202.40.text:
I felt like he just didn't want 
 anything to do with me,

204.84.text:
even though I'd not really 
 done that much wrong.

207.88.text:
For me, that was the easiest 
 way of getting over things.

211.12.text:
Why didn't you want to talk to me? 
 Why didn't you get in touch?

216.52.text: Because you seemed happy. I wasn't.

219.72.text:
I wasn't that happy. I might've 
 looked it, but... I know, but...

226.36.text:
Within about the first 
 two or three months,

229.32.text: we moved into my mum's house.

232.84.text: We were arguing all the time.

234.88.text:
It put a lot of pressure 
 on the relationship,

237.04.text: we got underneath each other's skin.

241.28.text: Did we move in together too fast?

245.16.text:
Yeah, I definitely think 
 we moved in together too fast.

249.08.text:
Us being at my mum's in that 
 bedroom all the time, like,

252.68.text: was no good for our relationship.

254.72.text:
But then I feel like we're 
 at a stage now where,

257.52.text:
like, you know, if we wanted 
 to get back together,

259.88.text:
I would want to move in together, 
 like, I don't know.

262.20.text: Or is that just me rushing again?

264.60.text:
Since we broke up, 
 I have missed her a lot

267.12.text:
and I've not really gone out a 
 lot because, to be honest,

271.20.text:
I don't feel like I've 
 been myself, really.

273.44.text: Do you want some of mine?

277.08.text:
I regret how we broke up 
 because I do still have

280.44.text:
feelings for Callum and I don't want
 it to be bitter between us.

285.00.text:
Can we learn from our 
 mistakes and try again?

292.32.text: I still love you, I always will.

294.72.text:
You're always in the back of 
 my mind no matter what I do.

300.24.text:
But it's hard, like, because I've 
 always wanted to sort things out.

304.96.text: I do, I do really miss you, like,

308.08.text:
you literally are like 
 my best friend.

310.40.text:
Like, it's like losing a best 
 friend and a boyfriend.

313.16.text:
Space is what we needed. 
 Maybe this is what we needed

318.12.text:
Time away from each other 
 and realise what,

321.72.text: you know, we have lost, like...

328.88.text:
It feels amazing that he still has 
 feelings for me because I still have

333.68.text:
feelings for him, but I just wish 
 he would've contacted me sooner.

337.08.text: She is like my soul mate.

338.48.text:
She's got an amazing personality 
 and I do love her to bits.

341.96.text:
I'm happy to give things 
 another go if you are.

345.48.text:
But I mean, there is 
 no rush, is there?

347.24.text: Yeah. We can just go step-by-step.

352.76.text:
would you like to go 
 and have a drink?

359.48.text:
I think we've both learnt 
 from this that we need to have space

363.40.text:
but we also need to be honest 
 with each other.

365.80.text:
I feel like we can put 
 the past in the past

367.88.text:
and move on and be a happy couple 
 and see what the future brings.
